summary: Find 24-hour comfort food and Ukrainian specialties at this East Village standby.

name: Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse
summary: Fogo de Chão is an authentic Brazilian steakhouse (churrascaria) that has been setting the standard in Brazil since 1979.

name: La Marchande
summary: La Marchande is chef John Fraser’s modernized take on the French brasserie, set in The Wall Street Hotel.

name: The Uptown Garrison
summary: With specialty coffee, breakfast sandwiches, brick-oven pizza and craft cocktails on offer, The Uptown Garrison has something to satisfy your cravings from morning till night.

name: Ma•dé
summary: Ma•dé draws inspiration from the sandy beaches of Bali for both its menu and décor.

name: Lorenzo's Restaurant, Bar & Cabaret
summary: Lorenzos Restaurant, Bar & Cabaret serves modern Italian and American fare at breakfast, lunch, and dinner daily.

name: Aromi
summary: Aromi is a restaurant and pizzeria with a mission to bring classic, authentic Italian recipes to Carroll Gardens in Brooklyn.

name: Tarallucci e Vino - NoMad
summary: From their handcrafted pastries every morning, to their fresh pastas and locally and seasonally inspired Italian plates at night, Tarallucci e Vino invites you to start or end your day and unwind with them.

name: Maizal
summary: Maizal Restaurant is a family-owned restaurant featuring authentic Mexican cuisine from Puebla.

name: Cafe D'Alsace
summary: Café D'Alsace has been an Upper East Side institution for more than two decades, serving Alsatian cuisine in a uniquely special setting.

name: Hunt & Fish Club NYC
summary: Hunt & Fish Club NYC debuted in Midtown Manhattan in 2014 with a classic yet contemporary menu of exceptionally prepared steaks and game plus a unique selection of canapés and seafood offerings.

name: El Coco - Hell's Kitchen
summary: El Coco is a new taqueria in Hell's Kitchen with a twist, featuring authentic Mexican dishes, empanadas, traditional tacos, and a variety of signature sauces.

name: AperiBar
summary: This chic restaurant and cocktail bar serves uncomplicated food and cocktails in warm, stylish surroundings that invite conversation and sharing.

name: The Shell Seafood Kitchen
summary: The Shell is a modern seafood restaurant on Manhattan's Upper West Side that features a vibrant and sophisticated atmosphere.

name: Grand Brasserie
summary: The landmark Vanderbilt Hall, once Grand Central Terminal’s main waiting room, has been transformed into Grand Brasserie, a New York City meeting place with Parisian flair.

name: Soogil
summary: Chef Soogil Lim's refined French technique infuses with his Korean heritage for exceptional dishes that stay true to both.

name: Kyma
summary: Dine on pristine seafood at this upscale Greek restaurant.

name: Benjamin Prime
summary: Offering high quality food in luxurious environments, Benjamin Prime melds together classic steakhouse fare and fresh and vibrant seafood with the grill as the main focus.

name: Bar Primi - Bowery
summary: A cozy Bowery space with two bars for dining and drinking, Bar Primi is a casual corner pasta shop devoted to primi piatti (the pasta course), a staple in chef and co-owner Andrew Carmellini's repertoire.

name: Kashkaval Garden
summary: Kashkaval Garden offers a casual, relaxed environment in which to enjoy wines, cocktails and Mediterranean food in Hell's Kitchen.

name: Il Nonno
summary: The folks at Il Nonno, an Italian restaurant in Astoria, Queens, are passionate about creating a memorable dining experience for every guest.

name: Malibu Farm
summary: An indoor-outdoor, California-style restaurant that has views of the Brooklyn Bridge from Pier 17.

name: Tha Phraya
summary: Enjoy pure, original, unfiltered Thai food on Manhattan's Upper East Side at Tha Phraya.

name: Nick + Stef's Steakhouse
summary: Nick + Stef's is a masterful blend of ultra-stylish contemporary design and time-honored culinary artistry.

name: Momoya - Upper West Side
summary: The beloved Japanese restaurant Momoya has added this new incarnation on Manhattan's Upper West Side.

name: Qanoon
summary: Nostalgia and Palestinian comfort food rule at this casual Chelsea spot.

name: Essex
summary: Located in the historic Essex Street Market Building, Essex is a loft-like multilevel space with contemporary cuisine inspired by the flavors of the Lower East Side.

name: The Library at The Public
summary: The Library, named for the building's original use as the Astor Library, is a central element of the mezzanine level of this landmark edifice at Astor Place (which famously houses downtown performance venue The Public Theater).

name: Felice 64
summary: Italian wines and flavors from Tuscany are served in a modern space infused with traditional elements on the Upper East Side.

name: Manuela
summary: Manuela is a welcoming neighborhood restaurant and bar in SoHo where great contemporary art and food combine to create a convivial atmosphere and sense of abundance.

name: Takumen
summary: Restorative bowls of ramen, sashimi and sushi rolls are served up at this hip izakaya.

name: Boucherie West Village
summary: Boucherie West Village is a traditional French brasserie and steakhouse, celebrating Joie de Vivre, that prepares a menu of French classics and timeless bistro favorites, in addition to dry-aged steaks.

name: Meet the Meat
summary: This highly-regarded steakhouse in Astoria serves prime cuts of meat aged to perfection in a unique way, accompanied by superior customer service.

name: Wagamama - Murray Hill
summary: Wagamama serves fresh and nourishing Asian food inspired by the flavors of Japan.

name: Cosme
summary: Mexican inspired rather than straightforward Mexican describes the innovative, vibrant dishes at Enrique Olvera's Cosme.

name: Xolo
summary: Xolo serves contemporary Mexican cuisine with a dash of tradition for good measure in a casual and fun space near the Williamsburg Bridge.

name: Dagg Thai
summary: In Thai, "Dagg" means to eat in the warmest, friendliest way possible, just like inviting close friends to enjoy a meal together.

name: Blue Fin
summary: Set in Times Square—a neighborhood better known for trinkets and fast food chains—Blue Fin is an outlier and a standout.

name: DiWine
summary: DiWine is a wine bar and New American restaurant focused on natural biodynamic wines and hand-crafted cocktails in a relaxed atmosphere.

name: Maison Pickle
summary: Maison Pickle offers Continental classics and that iconic American sandwich, the French Dip, in a refined and relaxed setting for food and drink.

name: Limani
summary: Limani, the Greek and Mediterranean restaurant in Rockefeller Center, uses only the highest-quality local and Mediterranean seafood.

name: Empire Steak House - Midtown East
summary: Empire Steak House's location on the east side has two raised tiers of seating featuring wrap-around booths and a hand-painted dome.

name: The Leopard at Des Artistes

name: Mission Ceviche - Upper East Side
summary: Mission Ceviche, from chef Jose Luis Chavez and partner Brice Mastroluca, has become synonymous with modern Peruvian cuisine, offering a diverse array of dishes crafted from the freshest ingredients.

name: La Masseria
summary: Masseria means farmhouse in Italian, and this restaurant’s inspiration is evident in the stone walls and exposed wooden beams.

name: Kellari Taverna
summary: Located in Midtown Manhattan near the Theatre District, Kellari features traditional Greek cuisine, as well as the largest selection of Greek wines in any restaurant in the United States.

name: Morton's The Steakhouse—Manhattan

name: Club A Steakhouse
summary: This creation of restaurateur Bruno Selimaj (of Bruno Restaurant fame) combines characteristics of a traditional steakhouse with New World modernism in both the menu and decor.

name: Hearth
summary: Hearth is everything its name implies...a warm, comfortable restaurant with hospitality as its goal.

name: Twilight Lounge
summary: Twilight Lounge is a modern Chinese kitchen in the East Village where chef Peizheng Chen reimagines Cantonese and Sichuan cuisine.

name: A La Turka
summary: A La Turka is a Turkish restaurant known for its family recipes, lively atmosphere and authentic Mediterranean-style flavors.

name: Indian Table

name: The Flatiron Room - NoMad

name: The Bar Room at The Modern

name: Brooklyn Bowl
summary: Enjoy the world's first LEED-certified bowling alley and music venue.

name: Sarabeth's Park Avenue South
summary: Sarabeth's Park Avenue South offers contemporary American cuisine in an elegant yet modern atmosphere.

name: Pappas NYC
summary: With a diverse menu featuring traditional Greek eats with a modern approach, guests can indulge in live, wood-fire cooked meats and fish and small plates prepared with the utmost care.

name: Sarabeth's Central Park South
summary: At Sarabeth's Central Park South, you'll find contemporary American food, a warm atmosphere and the friendly service Sarabeth's restaurants are known for.

name: The Parlour Room

name: Atlantic Grill
summary: Just steps from Lincoln Center, this Upper West Side spot specializes in seafood of all sorts—oyster, clam and shellfish selections that change daily and market-fresh fish available simply grilled a la carte or as composed entrees.

name: Le Jardinier
summary: This chic French restaurant in Midtown has a vegetable-forward menu.

name: Gaia
summary: With a focus on fresh, high-quality ingredients and artfully crafted dishes, Gaia offers a dining experience that blends elegance and flavor in a vibrant, modern atmosphere.

name: Estiatorio Milos
summary: Pristine Mediterranean-style seafood shines in an industrial-chic Midtown setting at Milos.

name: Souvlaki GR - Midtown East
summary: Fast, cheap and friendly, Souvlaki GR exudes the same spirit as its food truck, which began the enterprise.

name: Tarallucci e Vino - Union Square
summary: This neighborhood Italian restaurant features handcrafted pastries every morning, grilled panini on homemade focaccia and salads at lunch, and fresh pastas and locally and seasonally inspired Italian plates at night.

name: Stone Park Cafe
summary: Park Slope, Brooklyn, has quickly risen to New York restaurant fame, and this neighborhood hotspot is no exception.

name: Manhatta
summary: Feast on stunning views of the City and a compelling New American menu.

name: The Orchard Townhouse
summary: The Orchard Townhouse is a comfy eatery set in a four-story Chelsea townhouse, offering American plates and twists on classic cocktails.

name: Chez Nick
summary: Three chefs have collaborated to create an elevated neighborhood dining experience at this Upper East Side seasonal New American restaurant.

name: Chazz Palminteri Italian Restaurant
summary: Chazz Palminteri's features the finest meat, seafood and pasta dishes, as well as antipasto and traditional Italian desserts.

name: Reyna
summary: Reyna is an alluring Mediterranean tapas restaurant and cocktail bar nestled in Union Square.

name: The Quimby
summary: The Quimby is named after the United State's first licensed female pilot, Harriet Quimby, a pioneer in aviation, known for her style and adventurous spirit.

name: Felice 15 Gold Street
summary: Felice, the ultimate Tuscan restaurant and wine bar, already in two locations on the Upper East Side in NYC, is also in the Financial District.

name: Mission Ceviche - Union Square
summary: Mission Ceviche, from chef Jose Luis Chavez and partner Brice Mastroluca, has become synonymous with modern Peruvian cuisine, offering a diverse array of dishes crafted from the freshest ingredients.

name: Sushi Ann
summary: Businesspeople flock to this no-frills sushi joint for both lunch and post-work dinners.

name: Tanoreen
summary: Many are willing to travel far for food this good.

name: Redeye Grill
summary: This cavernous restaurant captures the richness of NYC with a big, inclusive menu that ranges from miso to matzo ball soup and Cobb salad.

name: Barbetta
summary: Owned by the same family for more than a century, Barbetta is a romantic Italian restaurant with ornate décor and a lush back garden.

name: Legasea
summary: Legasea combines a top-tier seafood menu with a fun atmosphere.

name: Molyvos
summary: A meal at this high-end Midtown eatery is sure to put you in a sunny mood.

name: Animo!
summary: Ánimo! is an authentic Mexican restaurant dedicated to honoring the rich culinary traditions of Mexico.

name: Tin Marín
summary: This stylish, upscale tapas bar combines Latino fusion small plates and entrees—like sophisticated versions of paella, skirt steak with mashed mangu, sweet plantains with cheese or pulpo al gallego (octopus with potatoes)—with a chic atmosphere.

name: Il Buco Alimentari & Vineria
summary: Find a restaurant, market, salumeria and bakery all in one spot.

name: The Dolar Shop Hot Pot
summary: The Dolar Shop's philosophy is to continuously innovate, always serve fresh ingredients, and to excel in customer service to build a strong connection with their guests, and proudly showcase the Macau hot pot culture.

name: Noreetuh
summary: Noreetuh is a modern Hawaiian restaurant in the East Village from chef Chung Chow.

name: Tao Uptown
summary: This pan-Asian hotspot leaves no stone unturned with its menu, which covers Thai, Chinese and Japanese cuisines.

name: Kru
summary: The concept at Kru is the modern interpretation of 100-year-old Thai recipes.

name: Four Twenty Five
summary: This new restaurant from chef Jean-Georges Vongerichten perfectly blends culinary excellence with architectural marvel and sustainability practices.

name: Leuca

name: No Work Allowed

name: Sant Ambroeus—West Village
summary: Shortly after the original Sant Ambroeus opened its doors in Milan in 1936, a devoted following emerged.

name: Il Cortile
summary: This old-world Mulberry Street gem packs in the garlic lovers nightly, thanks to a gorgeous cocktail lounge and an ultra-romantic garden room.

name: Il Carino
summary: Il Carino’s pride is their delicious, cooked-with-care Italian cuisines, and fine service to meet patrons' needs.

name: Sae Ron
summary: Sae Ron is a modern Korean kitchen dedicated to harmoniously blending traditional Korean dishes with contemporary culinary flavors and techniques.

name: Park Ave Kitchen by David Burke
summary: Park Ave Kitchen by David Burke brings together delicious and authentic American fare with top-notch service in a fun atmosphere.

name: Celeste
summary: This neighborhood trattoria has been a reliable Upper West Side standby for a number of years.

name: Virgil's Real BBQ - Times Square
summary: Good barbeque is surprisingly hard to find in New York, but Virgil's was among the first to boldly promise the real deal.

name: Café Boulud
summary: Daniel Boulud's tribute to the original Café Boulud in Lyon, France, serves finely executed cuisine.

name: Altamirano’s Italian Ristorante
summary: Experience Italian classics with a twist at Altamirano's, family owned and operated by former Upper East Side waiters living their dream.

name: Lincoln Ristorante
summary: Lincoln Ristorante combines Chef Shea Gallante’s refined interpretation of Italian cuisine with the vision of restaurateur Nick Valenti.

name: Gaonnuri
summary: Gaonnuri's 39th floor penthouse in Koreatown affords wraparound views of Midtown.

name: Prohibition
summary: This bar/restaurant offers a wide variety of cocktails, casual American fare and live music every night after 9pm.

name: Il Mulino Prime | Soho
summary: This culinary haven in SoHo embraces the unique character of the surrounding neighborhood.

name: Kubeh
summary: Kubeh, a Greenwich Village restaurant dedicated to lesser known cuisines of the Middle East, is the product of chef Melanie Shurka and husband David Ort.

name: Zuma
summary: Zuma, the brainchild of award-winning co-founder and creator Rainer Becker, brings its internationally acclaimed style of modern Japanese cuisine to Midtown Manhattan.

name: Rosemary's West Village
summary: Rosemary's evokes an enclosed Italian courtyard, full of greenery, reclaimed-wood tables, exposed-brick walls and terra-cotta flooring.

name: Gallaghers Steakhouse
summary: Back in the prohibition years, Gallaghers Steakhouse served as a speakeasy.

name: Clara
summary: Set inside the iconic New-York Historical Society building across from Central Park, Clara offers upscale New York classics.

name: Yakiniku Futago
summary: Sleek and dimly lit Yakiniku Futago specializes in Japanese barbecue.

name: Del Frisco's Grille
summary: Located near Radio City and Times Square, Del Frisco's Grille features a sweeping bar with a wood-burning oven, expansive walls showcasing more than 700 bottles of wine and a sprawling patio perfect for al fresco dining.

name: La Pulperia
summary: La Pulperia, modeled after the general stores found throughout South America, features rustic Latin cuisine with European influences.

name: Eléa
summary: The Upper West Side welcomes a modern split-level Greek restaurant.

name: Nami Nori - Williamsburg
summary: Nami Nori is a cozy Williamsburg spot to try the innovative temaki hand rolls—a sort of Japanese version of tacos.

name: Dear Strangers
summary: Dear Strangers is a Latin-inspired Modern American restaurant and cocktail bar located in Greenwich Village.

name: Fresco by Scotto
summary: For more than three decades, Fresco by Scotto, a family-run venture, has been a go-to destination for celebrities, CEOs, and New Yorkers in the know.

name: Gran Morsi
summary: Gran Morsi, named after the Italian word for "bites" epitomizes elegant simplicity.

name: Sant Ambroeus—SoHo
summary: An exquisite menu by chef Marco Barbisotti, a native of Milan, reflects the brand's culinary vision and historic origins of Northern Italy, including its signature vitello tonnato, cotoletta milanese and risotti.

name: Altesi Ristorante
summary: The elegantly modern and sophisticated Altesi Ristorante, on the Upper East Side, offers a menu consisting of Tuscan-inspired dishes.

name: Bixi
summary: Bixi offers dishes and drinks that are packed with unforgettable flavors and served by a knowledgeable, friendly staff.

name: T. Brasserie
summary: T. Brasserie serves timeless French fare using only the finest and freshest ingredients from breakfast through dinner.

name: Aqua New York
summary: Aqua New York has two separate restaurants—Aqua Roma and Aqua Kyoto—each a master of its own cuisine to bring this unique lifestyle dining concept to the table.

name: Le Rivage
summary: This traditional French restaurant is located in the heart of the Theatre District and has been operated since 1984 by the Denamiel family.

name: Sagaponack
summary: Sagaponack is a seafood restaurant specializing in chef-driven approachable quality.

name: Veerays
summary: Located in Manhattan's Midtown East, Veerays is NYC’s first Indian speakeasy restaurant, envisioned by Michelin-starred chef Hemant Mathur.

name: The Ivory Peacock
summary: The Ivory Peacock offers distinct, imaginative cocktails complemented by a variety of vibrant shareable plates.

name: Miss Lily's 7A
summary: Miss Lily’s 7A, the beloved Caribbean hotspot in the East Village, embodies the best elements of the original with delicious island cooking, friendly staff, a sunny vibe and Caribbean flavor.

name: Iris
summary: Inspired by the rich culinary traditions of the Mediterranean, chef John Fraser explores the cuisine of the Aegean at Iris.

name: Pink Taco
summary: Pink Taco isn’t just another taco joint. What they’re after is a detonation of flavors dancing on your tastebuds.

name: Sempre Oggi
summary: Born from Italian tradition and heritage, executive Chef Phillip Basone's menu takes seasonal and local ingredients and places them center stage.

name: Altesi Downtown
summary: You don't have to go all the way to Italy for authentic Tuscan cuisine—just as far as Spring Street.

name: Oscar Wilde
summary: This Victorian-themed bar features a cocktail list that reflects both the Victorian and Prohibition eras.

name: The Clocktower
summary: This chic 88-seat, David Rockwell-designed restaurant serves contemporary cuisine with British sensibilities.

name: Morgan's Brooklyn Barbecue
summary: Morgan's is Brooklyn through and through, a restaurant with a DIY edge that is as mindful of families with young kids as it is of the borough's bearded whiskey fanatics.

name: Docks Oyster Bar
summary: Docks Oyster Bar has been serving the freshest seafood and oysters for more than 25 years in Midtown Manhattan.

name: Serra
summary: Eataly's seasonal rooftop restaurant will transport you the Italian Alps.

name: La Contenta Oeste
summary: La Contenta Oeste offers a traditional Mexican menu with French accents and also features one of NYC's largest tequila, mezcal and alt agave selections.

name: La Pecora Bianca Midtown
summary: La Pecora Bianca Midtown offers an expanded menu from Mario Batali alum Cruz Goler in a bright, sophisticated space nearly twice the size of the original in NoMad.

name: 5 Napkin Burger - Hell's Kitchen
summary: 5 Napkin Burger serves up hearty and delightful fare, including their signature burger.

name: Rosevale Cocktail Room
summary: Rosevale Cocktail Room,  located inside the Civilian Hotel, offers a world-class beverage experience alongside delectable bites.

name: Kings of Kobe
summary: The towering American Wagyu burger creations and mouth-melting American Wagyu steaks—and the frenzy of sides—speak to the Kings of Kobe core: unadulterated, delicious fun.

name: Torch & Crown Brewing Company
summary: Torch & Crown Brewing Company, in Hudson Square, is Manhattan’s only production brewery and restaurant, a thirst-quenching gathering place with a New York-centric food and drinks program.

name: Uva Next Door
summary: Seasonal Italian classics and fantastic Amalfi style pizza paired with a cocktail-forward beverage program make Uva Next Door the playful little sister to the original Uva.

name: Olio e Più
summary: Inspired by the warmth and comfort of the Italian countryside, Olio e Più and chef Danilo Galati bring tradition and authentic Italian cuisine to the West Village.

name: Evalyn’s Tap House
summary: Experience the gastropub menu at Evalyn’s Tap House, which is thoughtfully curated by their talented chef, Steffen Sander.

name: Wayan
summary: Intoxicating Indonesian food from a talented chef in Nolita.

name: Boucherie Union Square
summary: Boucherie Union Square is a traditional French brasserie and steakhouse, celebrating Joie de Vivre, that prepares a menu of French classics and timeless bistro favorites, in addition to dry-aged steaks.

name: Gargiulo's
summary: In business since 1907 in the Historic Coney Island Amusement Area, Gargiulo's serves classic Neapolitan cuisine.

name: Churrascaria Plataforma Brazilian Steakhouse
summary: Churrascaria Plataforma Brazilian Steakhouse is a rodízio-style restaurant.

name: Le Pavillon
summary: Le Pavillon expresses chef Daniel Boulud’s roots in New York City with a fresh and unique approach to fine dining in a dramatic setting.

name: Wagamama - Midtown
summary: Wagamama first opened in London in April of 1992 with a clear purpose: to feed guests fresh and nourishing Asian food inspired by the flavors of Japan.

name: Schilling
summary: Schilling offers a day-to-night bistro that features Michelin-starred chef Eduard Frauneder's contemporary take on Austrian fare.

name: La Sirene UWS
summary: Chef/owner Didier Pawlicki's menu at La Sirène is crafted to reflect the best of South France and the freshest ingredients of the season.

name: State Grill and Bar
summary: State Grill and Bar, an elegant addition to the newly renovated Empire State Building, is open for breakfast, lunch and dinner.

name: Empellón
summary: Alex Stupak’s Midtown flagship is a warm and inviting venue with an extensive agave program and inventive menu.

name: Monterey
summary: Simon Oren, Dudi Sasson and chef James Tracey bring midtown Manhattan a glamorous bold American restaurant: Monterey.

name: The Palm - Midtown
summary: The second in a chain of Palm restaurants, this one is located in the Theatre District.

name: Stella 34 Trattoria
summary: This modern Italian trattoria and bar on Macy's sixth floor boasts soaring ceilings and beautiful natural light, not to mention impressive views of the Empire State Building.

name: Le Relais De Venise
summary: Renowned the world over for its steak frites, Le Relais de Venise L’Entrecôte’s signature dish is prepared using a famous Parisian secret sauce, as well as sinful French desserts.

name: Carmine's - Upper West Side
summary: About as old-school Italian as it gets, the legendary family-style Southern Italian Carmine's delivers everything but the red-checkered tablecloth.

name: Riverpark
summary: Enjoy the seasonally inspired, seafood-forward, New American cuisine with some of the best waterfront views NYC has to offer.

name: Tamarind Tribeca
summary: Avtar Walia, owner of Tamarind in the Flatiron District, has opened Tamarind TriBeCa in a handsome art deco building at the corner of Hudson and Franklin Streets.

name: The Sea Fire Grill
summary: Having perfected the classic steakhouse, the Benjamin Steakhouse Restaurant Group has moved beyond beef to conquer the seafood market.

name: Pappardella
summary: This longstanding Italian restaurant—on the Upper West Side since 1983—serves Tuscan cuisine.

name: Trattoria Dell'Arte
summary: A favorite of concert goers at nearby Carnegie Hall, Trattoria Dell'Arte is a design landmark, thanks to an interior done by the legendary Milton Glaser, and a entrance marked by a giant white nose.

name: Pera SoHo
summary: Pera SoHo is an eastern Mediterranean retreat inspired by its namesake Istanbul neighborhood.

name: Antica Pesa
summary: The Willliamsburg, Brooklyn eatery is the sister restaurant of the well-known Roman dining establishment, which has been run by the same family.

name: Steak Frites Bistro
summary: Chef/owner Adam Schop brings classic French fare, in an environment familiar to popular bistros found on the side streets of Paris, to Hell’s Kitchen.

name: Maiella
summary: Enjoy casual and rustic Italian waterfront dining in Long Island City.

name: The Dining Room at Gramercy Tavern
summary: Executive chef and partner Michael Anthony’s menu consists of elegant dishes with a rustic influence that showcases the restaurant’s relationships with local farms and purveyors.

name: De Mole - Williamsburg
summary: Chef Jose Luis Flores oversees a kitchen that specializes in mole poblano alongside other regional Mexican dishes.

name: Girasole Trattoria
summary: The Belgian-Brazilian couple behind Mojo Mousse Bar brings this Brazilian-inspired cocktail bar to El Barrio.

name: La Barra
summary: At La Barra, you can explore beloved dishes from numerous tapas bars all around Spain.

name: Oda House - Manhattan
summary: Devoted and passionate Michelin-recognized chef Maia Acquaviva, the co-founder of Oda House, immerses guests into the flavorful world of traditional Georgian dishes.

name: Naks
summary: Naks by Unapologetic Foods offers a gastronomic tour of the Philippines framed by the personal memories of the restaurant’s chef, Eric Valdez.

name: HanGawi
summary: Slide off your shoes and sit down on a comfortable pillow at this fine-dining establishment serving Korean-inspired vegetarian cuisine in Manhattan's Koreatown.

name: El Coco - Chelsea
summary: El Coco is a new taqueria in Chelsea with a twist, featuring authentic Mexican dishes, empanadas, traditional tacos, and a variety of signature sauces.

name: The Ribbon—Upper West Side
summary: The Ribbon—Upper West Side presents spit roasted meats, seafood and Blue Ribbon Restaurants classics in polished surrounds with rustic touches, plus an extensive bar and whisky program.

name: Da Andrea - Chelsea
summary: Experience the beauty of authentic Italian dining with a menu that specializes in the art of homemade pasta, traditional Italian dishes, delicious risottos, and more.

name: STK Rooftop
summary: STK Rooftop overlooks the beautiful High Line, right in the middle of the Meatpacking District.

name: Zero Otto Nove - Flatiron
summary: Roberto Paciullo's Flatiron District restaurant combines the menu of Paciullo's other Bronx outpost, Roberto's Restaurant, with that of the original Zero Otto Nove.

name: Dos Caminos Meatpacking District
summary: The fourth NYC outpost of this mod-Mexican mini-empire boasts a chic Meatpacking District address (in the prominent space formerly occupied by Vento Trattoria).

name: Oceana
summary: A beloved dining destination since 1992, Oceana is renowned for exceptional hospitality, an award-winning wine list, and world-class cuisine.

name: Keuka Kafe
summary: Keuka Kafe is a New American restaurant and wine bar in Forest Hills, Queens, that serves seafood, gourmet cheese, dessert and more with a full menu of wine, beer and mixed drinks.

name: Maggie's Place
summary: Family-owned since 1974, Maggie's Place serves up shepherd's pie, chicken pot pie, fish & chips, burgers and pub fare alongside a selection of wine and beer.

name: When in Bangkok
summary: When in Bangkok is a Thai restaurant that will transport you to a kitchen in Bangkok.

name: Nangman BBQ
summary: Nangman BBQ is a Korean barbecue restaurant created to celebrate the spirit of glamping.

name: Mito - Forest Hills
summary: Mito's esteemed head chef, who has devoted numerous years to the masterful art of cooking, brings with him a wealth of experience at esteemed establishments such as Jean Georges and Buddha Bar.

name: Perrine
summary: Under the direction of executive chef/culinary director Vincenzo Garofalo, the farm-to-table restaurant's seasonally inspired menus skew toward what's fresh and fun.

name: The Fulton
summary: Dine at Jean-Georges Vongerichten's celebration of fresh seafood in the Seaport.

name: David Burke Tavern
summary: David Burke Tavern is a modern American tavern on the Upper East Side that features American plates as a reflection of chef Burke’s contemporary approach to cooking, with a nod to elevated New York classics.

name: Tasca NYC
summary: Tasca (Iberian for "tavern") brings together the vibrant flavors and culinary traditions of both Spain and the islands of the Latin Caribbean: Puerto Rico, the Dominican Republic and Cuba.

name: American Cut Tribeca
summary: American Cut Steakhouse pays homage to the best original and aspirational New York dining experience, the steakhouse.

name: Del Frisco's Grille - Brookfield Place
summary: Del Frisco’s features a steakhouse-style menu, with classic starters like a wedge salad and choice cuts of broiled steaks.

name: Metropolis
summary: Metropolis is a vibrant contemporary American restaurant from Marcus Samuelsson within the Perelman Performing Arts Center in Lower Manhattan.

name: San Carlo
summary: San Carlo Osteria Piemonte is a corner of Turin in Soho.

name: Gui Steakhouse
summary: Gui Steakhouse is elevated steakhouse experience that integrates the unique flavors and techniques of Korean beef grilling.

name: Frenchman's Dough
summary: The Frenchman’s Dough is a traditional Italian restaurant with a French twist, serving freshly made pastas and perfectly charred pizzas.

name: Treadwell Park - Upper East Side
summary: Treadwell Park’s craft beer hall offers 20 rotating draft beers and ciders, delivered by on-site "flux capacitor."

name: Golden K Burgers
summary: This cozy, Korean-American family-owned restaurant offers a diverse selection of beef, veggie, seafood, and chicken burgers, each served with a side of crispy fries, pepperoncini, and pickles.

name: Mable's Smokehouse and Banquet Hall
summary: Smoky brisket, pulled pork and St. Louis–style ribs taste authentic and won't set you back too much.

name: Stout NYC Grand Central
summary: Find Stout NYC Grand Central in the midst of New York City icons including the Chrysler Building and the New York Public Library.

name: Barbalu Bklyn
summary: This Boerum Hill Italian restaurant is Stefano Barbagallo and Adriana Luque's second, following their Seaport location that opened in 2013.

name: Momofuku Noodle Bar
summary: David Chang’s original Korean-American sensation.

name: The Terrace and Outdoor Gardens
summary: Dine amidst the abundant greenery at The Terrace Restaurant, a casual, all-day eatery inspired by the French brasseries and American chophouses chef and restaurateur John Fraser worked at early in his career.

name: Carne Mare
summary: Carne Mare is an Italian chophouse by chef Andrew Carmellini offering prime cuts of steaks, fine seafood and Italian specialties.

name: Rynn Thai Restaurant & Bar
summary: Whether you are a Thai food enthusiast or someone new to the cuisine, Rynn Thai Restaurant & Bar offers the vibrant tapestry of Thai cuisine.

name: Mesiba
summary: Tel Aviv-inspired restaurant takes inspiration from Bar Lab Hospitality’s founding partner Elad Zvi’s childhood memories of the diverse flavors of Israel.

name: Mamo
summary: Mamo brings a long tradition of Italian hospitality and provençal charm to New York City's SoHo neighborhood.

name: Mark's Off Madison
summary: This restaurant-bakery combines rustic Italian and European cooking and traditional Jewish food. Alongside fresh homemade pastas, entrée salads and Belgian fries, there's Jewish deli rye and hand-rolled bagels and bialys.

name: Neir's Tavern
summary: The oldest bar in Queens (and possibly the City), Neir's serves up a simple setting and uncomplicated drinks.

name: Blackbarn
summary: Blackbarn is an American restaurant serving local, artisanal food in the comfort of a modern barn setting.

name: French Roast
summary: Upper West Siders have flocked to this popular French cafe for years for a taste of their bistro favorites, like croque monsieur, steak frites, French onion soup, duck confit and burgers, as well as a full brunch menu.

name: Cull & Pistol Oyster Bar
summary: The Cull & Pistol Oyster Bar is a Michelin-acclaimed seafood restaurant located in Chelsea Market.

name: Sarabeth's Upper West Side
summary: Established just across the street from the very first Sarabeth's location, Sarabeth's Upper West Side has been a neighborhood staple serving breakfast, lunch, brunch and dinner seven days a week for nearly 30 years.

name: Kurant Wine Bar
summary: This inviting neighborhood wine bar serves dozens of red, white and sparkling wines by the glass and bottle.

name: Marlow Bistro
summary: Marlow Bistro combines its Mediterranean roots with a European sensibility, and strives to create a warm and welcoming space.

name: Beauty & Essex
summary: Hidden behind a functioning pawn shop, Beauty & Essex is a true gem on the Lower East Side and widely regarded as one of New York's most beautiful restaurants.

name: Calle Dão - Bryant Park
summary: Calle Dão pays homage to Havana’s once-thriving El Barrio Chino (Chinatown), once the largest such community in Latin America.

name: Vino &... - Eataly NYC Downtown
summary: Vino &..., the wine bar in the heart of the marketplace at Eataly NYC Downtown, brings the best of Italian wines into one restaurant and bar in downtown New York.

name: Palo Santo
summary: At Palo Santo, you’ll find chef Jacques Gautier’s pan-Latin cooking in a Brooklyn brownstone.

name: Oceans
summary: With a name like Oceans, it’s no surprise to learn that this restaurant’s menu is inspired by fresh catches from the Atlantic, Pacific and Mediterranean.

name: Hear & There
summary: Hear & There is an listening bar and omakase restaurant in Williamsburg from husband-wife team Howard Ng and Samantha Nie of Third Date Hospitality.

name: Ben & Jack's 44th Street
summary: Ben and Jack Sinanaj, long-time waiters at Peter Luger’s, have opened a classic steakhouse all their own.

name: Palermo Argentinian Bistro - Gramercy
summary: Executive chef Carlos Barroz and his partners in Palermo Argentinian Bistro on Manhattan’s Restaurant Row have opened this second location in Gramercy.

name: Travelers Poets & Friends
summary: Travelers Poets & Friends captures the essence of the Italian coastline with its authentic offerings.

name: Central Park Boathouse
summary: Nestled in the park, right on the lake, is the Central Park Boathouse, an iconic and elegant restaurant with both indoor and outdoor seating, and different menus (in different price ranges) for each seating area.

name: Bocca Di Bacco—Chelsea
summary: Boasting an Italian-centric wine list of over 300 distinct selections to match with the menu overseen by executive chef Kristin Sollenne, the restaurant brings a contemporary, farm-to-table approach to Italian dining.

name: Delmonico's
summary: The classic NYC steakhouse, in business since 1837, is where eggs Benedict and baked Alaska were said to be invented.

name: Warren Street Bar & Restaurant
summary: This modern neighborhood brasserie offers an all-day menu of much-loved classics and fresh, seasonal dishes filled with flavors and ingredients from around the world.

name: Darbar Grill
summary: Darbar Grill, conveniently located in the heart of East Midtown, serves up solid, fresh Indian cuisine.

name: BLT Prime
summary: BLT Prime’s Upper East Side location has an expanded menu featuring signature standouts such as a selection of USDA Prime and 100% naturally raised Black Angus.

name: Francie
summary: Francie is a New American brasserie serving a menu inspired by French and Italian flavors.

name: Victor's Cafe
summary: Victor’s, in the Theatre District, has been a redoubt for high-end Cuban food for decades.

name: Treadwell Park - Downtown
summary: Treadwell Park’s craft beer hall offers 20 rotating draft beers and ciders, as well as beer in some of the cocktails and ice cream floats.

name: Cebu Bar & Bistro
summary: The New American cuisine at Cebu Bar & Bistro includes roast chicken, burgers and risotto balls with porcini mushroom.

name: The Gallery
summary: Enjoy artwork alongside delicious culinary creations and original cocktails at The Gallery, a new cultural space in the Flatiron District from chef Hiroki Odo.

name: Wonderland Bar
summary: Wonderland holds pride in their captivating presentations of magical cocktail creations paired with Sichuan-inspired tapas.

name: Loring Place
summary: Loring Place offers seasonal, local, American cuisine by Chef Dan Kluger in the heart of Greenwich Village.

name: Pete's Tavern
summary: Pete's Tavern is the oldest continuously operating bar and restaurant in New York City.

name: Draught 55
summary: Draught 55, founded by Katrina McNamee in 2012, provides an exceptional, seasonally curated food menu and a carefully curated beer and cocktail selection.

name: JoJo
summary: A lavishly gorgeous and perfectly refined town house is home to one of Jean-Georges Vongerichten's greatest dining accomplishments.

name: Psaraki
summary: Psaraki, the creation of longtime hospitality veteran James Paloumbis, evokes the charm of seaside tavernas found along the shores of Greece.

name: Barano
summary: Fire-roasted, grandma-inspired Italian food in Williamsburg.

name: Mae Mae Cafe & Plant Shop
summary: Mae Mae Cafe & Plant Shop is a plant-based cafe and bar in Mott Haven that is also a plant shop.

name: Nudibranch
summary: Nudibranch is a Korean-Spanish restaurant that serves thoughtful small plates, juicy wines and cocktails in a chic space in the East Village.

name: Indochine
summary: French-Vietnamese cuisine is served in this perennial hot spot.

name: Bocca Di Bacco—Hell's Kitchen
summary: Bocca Di Bacco—Hell's Kitchen, an Italian restaurant located near Columbus Circle and Central Park, is a favorite spot for celebrities, tourists and native New Yorkers alike.

name: La Grande Boucherie
summary: With a dazzling dining gallery, this one-of-a-kind brasserie is built in the tradition of the Belle Epoque, inspired by elegant and ornamental Art Nouveau style.

name: DomoDomo NYC
summary: Domodomo is a premier Japanese restaurant specializing in handrolls, sushi, and modern interpretations of traditional Asian dishes.

name: Baires Grill New York
summary: The menu at Baires Grill New York features homemade dishes that capture the rich, traditional flavors of Argentine cuisine.

name: The Wolfe
summary: The Wolfe is a sports bar and restaurant inspired by Tom Wolfe, the late novelist and long-time NYC resident.

name: T Bar
summary: New York has some of the best steaks in the country, and this restaurant on the Upper East Side certainly holds its own.

name: Michael's
summary: Michael's has long functioned as a power-breakfast-and-lunch scene for the who's who of media.

name: Le Gratin
summary: Le Gratin echoes the traditional bistros and bouchons of chef Daniel Boulud's hometown of Lyon, France, known for their welcoming ambiance and soulful cuisine.

name: Casa Lever
summary: At Casa Lever, Modern art and timeless architecture set the stage for Italian classics, curated wines and supreme hospitality.

name: The Dram Shop Bar
summary: The Dram Shop Bar is a locally owned sports bar and restaurant in Park Slope.

name: Souvlaki GR - Lower East Side
summary: Fast, cheap and friendly, Souvlaki GR exudes the same spirit as its food truck, which began the enterprise.

name: Red Hook Lobster Pound
summary: The famous lobster rolls at this Red Hook mainstay aren't all you'll find on the menu, but their popularity is a sure sign you should sample one.

name: The Greenhouse Cafe
summary: There's almost always a party at the Greenhouse Café, a popular Bay Ridge venue where many local Brooklynites celebrate their weddings, anniversaries and other special events.

name: La Mercerie
summary: A modern French restaurant resides inside a posh Soho lifestyle store.

name: STK Downtown
summary: Simply put, STK is not your daddy's steakhouse.

name: Scarpetta
summary: It all started in a Greek revival townhouse on the edge of the Meatpacking District, where LDV Hospitality brought an unexpected and soulful touch to Italian cuisine.

name: Fandi Mata
summary: Fandi Mata delivers a new take on artisinal, global cuisine inspired by the vast Mediterranean region, featuring classics with a contemporary touch.

name: Anassa Taverna - Manhattan
summary: Anassa ("breath of fresh air" in Greek) is an elegant interpretation of the traditional Greek taverna.

name: Kokomo
summary: Influenced by the rich and exotic culture of the Caribbean, Kokomo's cuisine builds on familiar island ingredients and offerings with a modern flair.

name: The Russian Tea Room
summary: This opulent restaurant has been a treasured destination since 1927, serving continental classics in a soaring setting.

name: The Long Room
summary: The Long Room is an authentic Irish bar and gastropub located in Times Square.

name: Dowling’s at The Carlyle
summary: Dowling’s at The Carlyle's menu features chef Moosah Reaume’s interpretations of timeless New York favorites and throwback dishes from another era, with an emphasis on tableside preparations.

name: Nusr-Et - Midtown
summary: Nusr-Et is an internationally acclaimed destination for luxury dining from Nusret "Salt Bae" Gökçeis, a Turkish butcher, chef, and restaurateur whose technique became an internet meme.

name: The Queensboro
summary: This modern, spacious American restaurant also has a great cocktail list.

name: Baci & Abbracci
summary: Baci & Abbracci offers traditional Neapolitan fare as well as Italian classics from all over the "Boot."

name: Filé Gumbo Bar
summary: Beyond the signature gumbo, dining at Filé is an educational feast of the culinary subtleties of Cajun and Creole food.

name: The Chemistry Room
summary: The Chemistry Room is an innovative and modern take on traditional Japanese cuisine that combines tradition with unforgettable modern flair.

name: House of the Red Pearl
summary: The House of the Red Pearl is a clandestine fine dining restaurant.

name: Roey's
summary: This sister restaurant to West Village mainstay Rosemary’s is an all-day Italian café-bar serving wholesome Italian fare in a casual and sophisticated setting.

name: Tucci
summary: Tucci, New York's newest Italian restaurant, serves refined modern Italian cuisine and family recipes in a warm and inviting atmosphere.

name: Jacques Brasserie
summary: Jacques Brasserie is a romantic bistro that feels like one of those off-the-tourist track places that you always hope to find in Paris.

name: Jacob's Pickles
summary: Pickles are more than just a garnish at this Southern-inspired eatery; they're a way of life.

name: Ilili Restaurant
summary: Ilili is New York's premier contemporary Mediterranean restaurant, offering inspired Lebanese cuisine.

name: Nizza
summary: Nizza takes its name from the Italian word for the French region of Nice, and its menu is French-Italian fusion.

name: Porter House
summary: Carnivores and sophisticates meet at this all-American steakhouse, opened in 2006 by star chef Michael Lomonaco.

name: Philippe by Philippe Chow Downtown
summary: This newly renovated subterranean dining space offers a family-style menu that emphasizes traditional Beijing cuisine with an elevated twist.

name: Tinto Tapas Restaurant & Wine Bar
summary: Indulge in the art of sharing and enjoy an elevated tapas experience in Tinto Tapas Restaurant & Wine Bar's cozy and inviting space.

name: Soba Totto
summary: Soba Totto serves soba, yakitori and other Japanese specialties just a short walk from Grand Central Terminal.

name: Lillie's Victorian—Union Square
summary: Combines an authentic ostentatious decor and mellow ambiance, representing one of the last great Victorian "gin palaces" that once flourished in the industrial cities of Northern Ireland and England.

name: Pera Mediterranean Brasserie
summary: This gem of a bistro serves innovative interpretations of classic Greek and Turkish dishes in Murray Hill.

name: Nougatine at Jean-Georges
summary: Perhaps the best way to sample dishes from one of world-famous chef Jean-Georges Vongerichten's menus without breaking the bank is by dining at Nougatine, an overlooked gem on the Upper West Side.

name: Red Rooster Harlem
summary: Marcus Samuelsson's restaurant focuses on elevated American comfort food.

name: Sinigual
summary: Sinigual celebrates a fusion of contemporary and native flavors of Mexico.

name: Obao Midtown East
summary: Michael Bao Huynh, of Bia Garden and Baoguette fame, brings his formula—Pan-Asian food in a sleek setting—to the east side.

name: Burger & Lobster Bryant Park
summary: Burger & Lobster has been serving the finest of burgers and the freshest of lobsters since 2014.

name: Robert
summary: Robert, located atop the Museum of Arts and Design on Columbus Circle, offers an expansive view of Central Park and Broadway.

name: Industry Kitchen
summary: Industry Kitchen serves simply prepared modern American dishes with views of the Brooklyn and Manhattan Bridges and Brooklyn skyline.

name: Benjamin Steakhouse
summary: This opulent gem near Grand Central Terminal is the offspring of Peter Luger alumni Benjamin Prelvukaj and chef Arturo McLeod, who bring with them more than 20 years of experience.

name: Rosa Mexicano - Lincoln Center
summary: Setting a standard in authentic Mexican cooking since opening its doors, Rosa Mexicano now has three locations throughout NYC.

name: Konban
summary: Konban is a contemporary Japanese restaurant offering an exquisite dining experience with a focus on katsu, housemade udon like mazemen, and other creative izakaya dishes.

name: Tavern on the Green
summary: One of NYC's most recognizable restaurants is tucked just inside Central Park. It serves up American fare in an elegant indoor-outdoor setting.

name: Frankie & Johnnie’s Steakhouse
summary: With some serious steaks and chops, this welcoming and unpretentious spot has quite the history as a real Prohibition-era speakeasy.

name: Stout NYC Penn Station
summary: The first Stout NYC location is comprised of 3-stories, over 16,000 square feet of space and multiple private party rooms.

name: Fish Cheeks
summary: Family-style Thai seafood and great cocktails in NoHo.

name: Lé Chai
summary: Lé Chai, located in Flatlands, Brooklyn, redefines the classic steakhouse experience with a Thai fusion twist.

name: Dagon
summary: The menu at Dagon, named for the Phoenician and Philistine god of agriculture and the earth, showcases modern Israeli cuisine with Levantine influences.

name: Bourbon Steak New York
summary: Bourbon Steak is chef Michael Mina's love letter to the classic American steakhouse, serving the finest cuts of premium beef and seafood, as well as seasonal ingredients sourced from local farmers and purveyors.

name: Mastro's Steakhouse NYC
summary: Mastro's collection of sophisticated steakhouses and Ocean Clubs has brought its masterful combination of world-class service, highly acclaimed cuisine and refinement to New York City.

name: Sotto la Luna
summary: Sotto la luna, located in Astoria, Queens, is an open-kitchen pasta bar and Neapolitan pizzeria that serves modern Italian food in an industrial, high-ceiling, open vibrant space.

name: Enoteca Harlem
summary: Enoteca Harlem was born from a journey to the Basque Country, the calmness of the coastal life, the scent of the sea breeze sweeping over the vineyards, and the joy of savoring fresh, local ingredients.

name: Felice Montague
summary: Felice Montague serves classic Italian dishes inspired by the traditional cuisine of the Tuscan countryside.

name: Margaux by La Sirène
summary: Margaux by La Sirène, a celebrated French restaurant offering an authentic and elegant taste of France since 2007, proudly serves timeless classics made with the finest ingredients and traditional techniques.

name: Pepolino
summary: Pepolino serves authentic Tuscan cuisine in TriBeCa.

name: Le B.
summary: Tableside presentations, intricate flavors, and forgotten pleasures mined from the history books are hallmarks of Le B.’s ethos.

name: Kanyakumari
summary: Dishes from India’s southernmost coastline get the spotlight at this spot from veteran restaurateur Salil Mehta and Kebab Aur Sharab's Dipesh Shinde.

name: Wan Waan
summary: The team at Wan Waan, a Thai restaurant in the Chelsea neighborhood of Manhattan, emphasizes feelings through the taste of food.

name: Dos Caminos Lexington
summary: Margaritas and Mexican cuisine meet serious south-of-the-border style at this boisterous, popular mega-eatery.
8282 is a light-hearted, fresh take on Korean food on the Lower East Side.

name: Conmigo - 87th and 1st
summary: Located on the Upper East Side of Manhattan, Conmigo is a modern Mexican restaurant with a bit of New York flair.

name: Gyu-Kaku Japanese BBQ – Flushing
summary: Gyu-Kaku specializes in yakiniku—Japanese barbecue meat over a charcoal grill.

name: Le Monde
summary: This restaurant in Columbia University’s neighborhood celebrates the cuisine of France's Loire Valley.

name: Murano Ristorante
summary: Executive chef Cesar Dutan infuses elements of Italian, French and Asian flavors into an inspiring menu of authentic Venetian staples and flavors from across Italy with daring twists and visual flair.

name: The Noortwyck
summary: Set in the West Village, The Noortwyck exudes an elegant yet intimate charm, offering a timeless, New American menu that celebrates seasonal dishes, an extensive wine selection and specialty cocktails.

name: Ishq
summary: The menu at this East Village restaurant is a celebration of India's culinary treasures—from aromatic curries to flavorful tandoori offerings, all made with the finest spices and ingredients.

name: Nizuc
summary: Nizuc brings Latin flair to Hudson Yards with contemporary coastal Mexican cuisine rooted in quality ingredients.

name: Sarabeth's Greenwich Village
summary: Located just a short walk from SoHo and West Village cultural landmarks, Sarabeth’s offers the perfect destination to enjoy both flavor and community in downtown NYC.

name: Nisí Estiatorio
summary: Nisí Estiatorio is a celebration of Greek culture and cuisine, with a contemporary twist.

name: Cacío e Pepe - East Village
summary: Cacío e Pepe is an authentic Italian restaurant named for its signature Roman dish—cacío e pepe—homemade pasta theatrically tossed out of a wheel of pecorino cheese.

name: Zoì Mediterranean Cuisine
summary: Located within The Life Hotel, a landmark of elegance and history, Zoì offers a refined yet welcoming dining experience where tradition meets innovation.

name: Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Elmhurst
summary: The menu includes delectable cuts of grilled meats such as sizzling steaks, lamb, chicken and pork carved tableside by Brazilian trained gaucho chefs as well as a lighter seafood option.

name: The Dynamo Room
summary: Featuring steakhouse classics, a raw bar, and curated cocktails, The Dynamo Room channels the vibrant spirit of New York’s historic grills.

name: The Otter
summary: Acclaimed chef Alex Stupak serves a menu focused on simply prepared seafood using the freshest ingredients from carefully selected purveyors.

name: Addictive Wine & Tapas Bar
summary: This tapas bar/restaurant serves dishes with influences of Spain and other Mediterranean countries.

name: Burrito Bar
summary: This Mexican restaurant is located in a converted house, with a bar on the first floor and restaurant seating on the second level.

name: Charoen Krung Thai Restaurant
summary: ​Experience the flavors of Bangkok at Charoen Krung Thai Restaurant, a Midtown East gem offering authentic Thai cuisine.

name: Patrick's on the Hill
summary: The menu at this Hamilton Heights restaurant features a mix of traditional Caribbean dishes and creative fusion offerings, with standout favorites like jerk chicken, oxtails, and Jamaican beef patties.

name: Hortus NYC
summary: The modern Asian cuisine at Hortus NYC reflects global influences.

name: SEA by Jungsik
summary: SEA is a vibrant, fun Southeast Asian restaurant from chef Jungsik Yim, with a raw bar, small plates and shareable plates, along with a smart beverage program.

name: Pig and Khao - Upper West Side
summary: Pig and Khao is inspired by chef Leah Cohen's Filipino heritage and extensive travels throughout Southeast Asia.

name: Korali Estiatorio
summary: Set in a serene, beautiful space with whitewashed arched walls and stonework reminiscent of Cretan Islands, this Upper East Sider focuses on Greek seafood.

name: Altair
summary: Located inside the Arlo Midtown, Altair serves modern American fare inspired by celestial wonder.

name: Cha Cha Tang
summary: This Chinese restaurant offers a playful rendition of a classic “cha chaan teng” (a Hong Kong-style cafe or diner) with a downtown fine-dining ambiance.

name: Gage & Tollner
summary: Gage & Tollner, opened in 1879, is the oldest landmark restaurant in New York, featuring Victorian decor and working gas lamps.

name: Safari
summary: Safari, located on a busy block in Harlem, may be the only Somali restaurant in the City.

name: Anassa Taverna - Downtown
summary: Nestled in Battery Park City, Anassa is an elegant interpretation of the traditional Greek taverna.

name: Sojourn Social
summary: Sojourn Social features a multifaceted venue paired with food and libations representing the melting pot of cultures and cuisines.

name: Leonetta
summary: Bringing Mediterranean warmth to Murray Hill at the edge of Kips Bay, Leonetta offers a refined yet inviting dining experience inspired by the coastal flavors of Southern Europe.

name: Jack & Charlie’s No. 118
summary: At Jack & Charlie’s No. 118, nostalgia meets modern flair in a New American menu inspired by mid-century supper clubs.

name: Supper Club by Le Petit Parisien
summary: This Upper East Side restaurant is a collaboration between Le Petit Parisien and chef Josh Newman, offering unique seasonal menus.

name: Levant on Smith
summary: Enjoy traditional French cuisine with a touch of Mediterranean flair, beautifully complemented by handcrafted, inspired drinks.

name: Table d'Hote
summary: With a small traditional menu, and a warm and inviting dining area, Table d'Hote is ideal for an intimate and delectable meal.

name: Siren Oyster Bar & Restaurant
summary: Siren is a contemporary European seafood restaurant in South Slope, Brooklyn, specializing in modern dishes and an extensive oyster selection.

name: Pylos
summary: Pylos brings fresh, wholesome cooking from all regions of Greece to an elegant, contemporary and comfortable setting in the East Village.

name: La Pecora Bianca Upper West Side
summary: La Pecora Bianca Upper West Side offers an expanded menu from Mario Batali alum Cruz Goler in a bright, sophisticated space.

name: La Pecora Bianca Upper East Side
summary: La Pecora Bianca Upper East Side offers an expanded menu from Mario Batali alum Cruz Goler in a bright, sophisticated space.

name: Little Alley
summary: Chef Yuchun Cheung, born and raised in one of Shanghai’s little alleys in a family of chefs and restaurateurs, decided that Little Alley should recreate the Shanghainese cuisine that he grew up with.

name: Cathédrale
summary: Under soaring ceilings and a monumental wire-mesh sculpture by Edoardo Tresoldi, executive chef Jason Hall delivers pure, ingredient-driven flavors.

name: Laut
summary: Laut presents the best recipes, dishes and flavors from South East Asia, preserving the flavor profiles of each dish while maintaining the integrity of each cuisine.

name: Carib-Soul Bk
summary: Carib-Soul brings bold Caribbean flavors to Prospect Heights, Brooklyn in a casual, welcoming setting.

53 introduces an elevated blend of Asian cuisine with a contemporary edge in a chic lifestyle setting, featuring an exciting rotating installation art program in collaboration with Friedrich Petzel Gallery.

name: Tinos
summary: Named after the picturesque Greek island known for its rich culture and stunning views, Tinos combines the charm of the Mediterranean with the taste of time-honored recipes.

name: Atlantis Prime
summary: Atlantis Prime offers a refined surf-and-turf experience near Herald Square in Manhattan, showcasing prime dry-aged steaks, fresh seafood, and expertly crafted sides in an elegant, modern setting.

name: Chocolat Restaurant & Bar
summary: Chocolat is a stylish comfort-food restaurant in Harlem that serves updates on Southern classics for brunch, lunch and dinner.

name: La Pecora Bianca Bryant Park
summary: La Pecora Bianca Bryant Park offers an expanded menu from Mario Batali alum Cruz Goler in a bright, sophisticated space.

name: Amélie - West Village
summary: At this Greenwich Village location, the intention is to make good wine accessible, affordable and fun.

name: Barawine
summary: This chic wine bar—overseen by Fabrice Warin, a restaurateur with roots in upmarket New York institutions like François Payard Bakery and Le Cercle Rouge—is an oenophile's dream.

name: Le Tout Va Bien
summary: The raison d’être of this cheery basement bistro is to get theater-going patrons fed and out the door by curtain time.

name: Amaranth
summary: Enjoy the typical approach to Mediterranean flavor with a mix of French and Italian cuisine, with generous portions, based on fresh products and full of sunshine and flavors.

name: Romeo's Italian Restaurant
summary: Romeo's Italian Restaurant offers fine Italian dining in Jackson Heights, Queens.

name: Pinky Swear
summary: Pinky Swear is an art-forward restaurant and cocktail bar on Manhattan's Lower East Side where creativity, connection, and discovery collide.

name: Yefsi Estiatorio
summary: Yefsi Estiatorio, a Greek restaurant on Manhattan's Upper East Side, features an upscale selection of souvlaki, seafood, and Greek Mediterranean cuisine.

name: Felice on Hudson
summary: Felice on Hudson fits seamlessly into the picturesque West Village, bringing an array of daily specials inspired by seasonal ingredients and an extensive Italian wine list to the neighborhood.

name: Flatiron Steakhouse
summary: Flatiron Steakhouse is a restaurant in Park Slope, Brooklyn, with an old-school neighborhood vibe.

name: Raf's
summary: The hearth-driven menu threads the needle through the south of France and Italy, highlighting dishes such as cast iron sfincione (Sicilian pizza), wood-kissed escargot, and dry-aged côte de bôeuf.

name: Café Carmellini
summary: James Beard Award-winning chef Andrew Carmellini distills his 30-year career into an extraordinary culinary experience that marks his return to fine dining.

name: Masaaki
summary: At Masaaki in Bayside, Queens, find go-to sushi rolls and hibachi, as well as delicately prepared 19-course omakase.

name: Smyth Tavern
summary: Smyth Tavern serves American tavern fare in Tribeca, featuring fresh fish, raw bar, dry-aged steaks, homemade pastas and a specialty burger.

name: Le Jardin Bistro
summary: Le Jardin Bistro stands out with its charming garden-inspired ambiance that makes diners feel as if they’ve been transported straight to France.

name: Guksu Jip
summary: Flushing's Guksu Jip serves various noodle dishes,includin special naengmyun (cold noodles with rich toppings), mul naengmyun (cold soup noodle), bibim naengmyun (spicy cold noodle), and hot noodle soup.

name: Paris Bar
summary: Paris Bar is an iconic French brasserie near Carnegie Hall and Central Park that serves traditional French fare from breakfast through supper every day, with brunch available on weekends, plus a rooftop bar.

name: Wayward Fare
summary: Wayward Fare, a rustic and elegant culinary journey in Prospect Heights, offers a seasonally charged menu that weaves together a tapestry of some lesser-known Mediterranean flavors.

name: Naro
summary: Naro’s menu focuses on the subtle and delicate flavors of Korean cuisine, drawing inspiration from classic dishes from various moments throughout Korean history.

name: Felice Columbus
summary: Felice Columbus brings the vineyards of the Tuscan countryside to the Upper West Side.

name: Little Fino
summary: Little Fino is an all day neighborhood bar and cafe located in North Williamsburg that serves a menu of Italian-inspired 'little somethings' alongside a playful cocktail list.

name: Wildflower
summary: Nestled beneath the iconic High Line, Wildflower offers an exceptional fusion of innovative cocktails and contemporary New American cuisine, thoughtfully crafted by the culinary director, chef Edwin Rivera.

name: Raval Steakhouse
summary: Set on Staten Island’s vibrant north shore, Raval Steakhouse is the vision of lifelong friends who have brought their passion for great food and hospitality back to their Staten Island roots.

name: Benihana
summary: Benihana is a dining experience unlike any other: guests are seated at communal tables in groups, where a personal chef will perform the ancient art of teppanyaki.

name: La Pecora Bianca SoHo
summary: La Pecora Bianca SoHo offers an expanded menu from Mario Batali alum Cruz Goler in a bright, sophisticated space.

name: Barlume
summary: Barlume is an all-day dining experience steeped in the sun-soaked flavors of the Mediterranean.

name: Noodle Bar - Uptown
summary: The Uptown outpost of David Chang’s Korean-American sensation.

name: María Mulata
summary: The restaurant offers a versatile, rich and colorful cuisine, and strives to represent every corner of Colombia with nature, art, elegance and biodiversity.

name: Lele's Roman
summary: Inspired by the lively neighborhood of Trastevere, Lele’s Roman brings a fresh take on Roman cuisine to Brooklyn's Boerum Hill neighborhood.

name: Catch n' Chop
summary: Catch n' Chop, situated on the Upper East Side, is a chef-driven modern American steakhouse with a focus on sustainable, fresh seafood and raw bar.

name: Masalawala & Sons
summary: Restaurateur Roni Mazumdar and Chintan Pandya explore the yesteryears of India from the perspective of a 75-year-old immigrant man from Kolkata—Roni’s father.

name: Asuka Sushi
summary: From various rolls to teriyaki, and many mouth-watering Japanese dishes, you'll be sure to find many different flavors to try.

name: Kahlo
summary: Enjoy guacamole, elevated tacos and plates of chicken mole and barbacoa, and choose from a long list of tequilas, mezcals and seasonal cocktails to accompany your meal.

name: Akoya
summary: A hidden gem inside St. Cloud Rooftop Bar, Akoya offers guests an authentic temaki experience in an intimate and elevated setting atop The Knickerbocker Hotel.

name: Oyamel
summary: At Oyamel, José Andrés and his team combine Mexico’s rich regional diversity with the vibrant urban atmosphere of Mexico City.

name: Sungold
summary: With an eye on the Mediterranean, chef Michael King and his team craft wood fired pizzas, handmade pastas, and large and small plates to share.

name: The Commissary at Metrograph
summary: Inspired by the golden age of Hollywood studio commissaries, this stylish restaurant is a hidden gem for film lovers and foodies alike.

name: Verde on Smith
summary: Verde on Smith is Cobble Hill, Brooklyn's neighborhood eatery, featuring regional Italian cuisine complemented by friendly service and warm ambiance.

name: Little Thai Kitchen
summary: You can find popular dishes such as drunken noodle, pad see-ew, and pad thai that are all made with fresh, savory ingredients.

name: Dhamaka
summary: Located at Essex Market on the Lower East Side of Manhattan, Dhamaka dives deep into the bold, provincial cooking rarely seen outside of Indian homes and roadside stalls.

name: Amélie - Upper West Side
summary: "La Petite Amélie" is smaller and more intimate than Amélie's other locations, but has the same look and vibe.

name: Vestry
summary: This dinner and weekend-lunch destination marries New American and Asian-inspired cuisine, emphasizing seasonal ingredients and seafood and vegetable dishes.

name: Acru
summary: In the main dining room, Acru offers a tasting menu inspired by global techniques and flavors gleaned from Chef Garwood’s Australian roots and a decade of cooking at some of the world’s top restaurants.

name: Max's Esca
summary: Max's Esca is a premier destination for exceptional dining and fine Italian cuisine on Staten Island.

name: Mamazul
summary: Mamazul Mexican Grill, located in NoMad, is a culinary gem that celebrates the vibrant flavors and traditions of Mexico.

name: Tonchin Brooklyn
summary: A modern Japanese restaurant featuring a full a la carte menu grounded in traditional flavors, with a New American twist.

name: See No Evil Pizza
summary: See No Evil Pizza is a modern New York pizzeria located on the concourse level of the 1 train 50th street subway station.
